body.p: The purpose of an import PI is to produce an XML-fragment from a database request.
body.pre: <?_wxt importdb connection="" sql="" driver="" xpath="" targetlocation="" transformation=""?>

tr.td: A connectionstring. In templates this parameter may be skipped. In this case the connection in contentelement (dbcontent) in the script is used.
A sql string. If sql is set, sqlfile is ignored.
The location of a file containing a sql string. If sql is set, sqlfile is ignored.

The result of the sqlquery, or queries, are saved as an XML-file. This XML-structure is base for transformation and following xpath extraction. targetlocation is optional, but it is very usefull to inspect this file when writing and debugging a transformation.
The encoding for the resulting xml. Default is UTF-8 if not changed in scrip (option:default-encoding)
Any xpath expression that identifies a nodeset that will be treated like a XML-fragment.

Possible values are yes and no, width default no. If parse is set to yes the imported material is supposed to be a parsable XML-fragment (XHTML-fragment) and WXT will include this fragment as is in the module. If xpath is used the fragment imported is considered "current node".
A transformation identifier (see: ). This transformation may have parameters. Transformation _table is predefined and produces a simple table from the extracted data. _table can take no parameters.

body.p: Styleclass describing a possible table-output from this PI is: dbresult, see distributed std styles.
body.pre: <?_wxt importdb connection="jdbc:mysql://frigg.hiof.no/fragments?user=a&password=b" sql="use fragments; select content from material where fragid = 3;" encoding="UTF-8" parse="yes" targetlocation="dbdump4.xml"?>
body.p: Importing and showing the result as a table
body.pre: <?_wxt importdb connection="jdbc:mysql://frigg.hiof.no/vin?user=a&password=b" sql="use vin; select type,name,dice,price from wines where country='Spania' and type='white'; select type,name,dice from wines where country = 'Frankrike' and type='sparkling' and dice=6;" encoding="UTF-8" transformation="_table" xpath="//div[@class='dbresult' and position()='1']" targetlocation="dbdump.xml"?>
body.p: Note the xpath stating that we will show the first of, in this case, two dbresults.
Importing and showing with a written transformation
body.pre: <?_wxt importdb connection="jdbc:mysql://frigg.hiof.no/vin?user=a&password=b" sql="use vin; select type,description,dice,name from wines where country = 'Frankrike';" encoding="UTF-8" transformation="vindb1(type='red',dice='1')" xpath="//div[@id='root']/*" targetlocation="dbdump1.xml"?>
